    37â†’## Introduction
    38â†’
    39â†’### Design Philosophy
    40â†’
    41â†’The Abe Diaz design system is built on principles of **clarity**, **simplicity**, and **intentional constraint**. Rather than offering unlimited flexibility, the system provides a curated set of design tokens and components that work harmoniously together.
    42â†’
    43â†’**Core Principles:**
    44â†’
    45â†’- **Minimalism First**: Every element serves a purpose. The design prioritizes content over decoration.
    46â†’- **Systematic Consistency**: A 4px spacing scale and carefully chosen color palette ensure visual harmony across the entire site.
    47â†’- **Performance-Conscious**: CSS-first approach with minimal JavaScript dependency for faster load times and better accessibility.
    48â†’- **Responsive by Default**: Mobile-first thinking with thoughtful breakpoints that adapt to different screen sizes without compromising the design intent.
    49â†’- **Accessibility Matters**: Color contrast ratios, semantic HTML, and keyboard navigation are first-class considerations.
    50â†’
    51â†’**Design Ethos:**
    52â†’
    53â†’This is a personal site for a technologist and evangelist. The design reflects the subject's personality: direct, authentic, and human. The teal accent color (#36BCAB) adds a touch of warmth to an otherwise neutral palette, while the Oswald typeface for headings provides strong visual hierarchy without being overly formal.
    54â†’
    55â†’The design system embraces constraints as a feature, not a limitation. By providing exactly what's neededâ€”no more, no lessâ€”it enables rapid development while maintaining consistency.
    56â†’
    57â†’### Overview
    58â†’

    60â†’

    89â†’### Color Palette

    91â†’The color palette is intentionally minimal, favoring a neutral foundation with a single vibrant accent. This approach ensures the design feels clean and professional while allowing content to remain the primary focus.

    97â†’2. **Neutral Grays** - An 8-step scale for subtle variations and hierarchy
    98â†’3. **Accent Colors** - Teal for warmth, Blue for external platforms

   703â†’The spacing system is designed around these core principles:

    34â†’
    35â†’---
    36â†’
    37â†’## Introduction
    38â†’
    39â†’### Design Philosophy
    40â†’
    41â†’The Abe Diaz design system is built on principles of **clarity**, **simplicity**, and **intentional constraint**. Rather than offering unlimited flexibility, the system provides a curated set of design tokens and components that work harmoniously together.
    42â†’
    43â†’**Core Principles:**
    44â†’
    45â†’- **Minimalism First**: Every element serves a purpose. The design prioritizes content over decoration.
    46â†’- **Systematic Consistency**: A 4px spacing scale and carefully chosen color palette ensure visual harmony across the entire site.
    47â†’- **Performance-Conscious**: CSS-first approach with minimal JavaScript dependency for faster load times and better accessibility.
    48â†’- **Responsive by Default**: Mobile-first thinking with thoughtful breakpoints that adapt to different screen sizes without compromising the design intent.
    49â†’- **Accessibility Matters**: Color contrast ratios, semantic HTML, and keyboard navigation are first-class considerations.
    50â†’
    51â†’**Design Ethos:**
    52â†’
    53â†’This is a personal site for a technologist and evangelist. The design reflects the subject's personality: direct, authentic, and human. The teal accent color (#36BCAB) adds a touch of warmth to an otherwise neutral palette, while the Oswald typeface for headings provides strong visual hierarchy without being overly formal.
    54â†’
    55â†’The design system embraces constraints as a feature, not a limitation. By providing exactly what's neededâ€”no more, no lessâ€”it enables rapid development while maintaining consistency.
    56â†’
    57â†’### Overview
    58â†’
    59â†’This documentation covers approximately 520 lines of CSS organized into:
    60â†’
    61â†’- **43 CSS Custom Properties** (Design Tokens)
    62â†’  - 14 color primitives
    63â†’  - 10 typography tokens (fonts, sizes, weights)
    64â†’  - 11 spacing values (4px-based scale)
    65â†’  - 4 layout dimensions
    66â†’  - 2 border radii
    67â†’  - 2 transition timings
    68â†’
    69â†’- **15+ UI Components**
    70â†’  - Layout structures (container, header, sidebar, footer)
    71â†’  - Typography variants (headings, links, paragraphs)
    72â†’  - Interactive elements (buttons, forms)
    73â†’  - Content modules (widgets, profile, contact sections)
    74â†’
    75â†’- **3 Responsive Breakpoints**
    76â†’  - Desktop (default)
    77â†’  - Tablet (â‰¤768px)
    78â†’  - Mobile (â‰¤480px)
    79â†’  - Small Mobile (â‰¤360px)
    80â†’
    81â†’The system is currently implemented as inline CSS in `index.html` and is designed to scale to a multi-page site with modular CSS architecture.
    82â†’
    83â†’---
    84â†’
    85â†’## Design Tokens
    86â†’
    87â†’Design tokens are the fundamental building blocks of the design systemâ€”the named values that define colors, typography, spacing, and other visual properties.
    88â†’
    89â†’### Color Palette
    90â†’
    91â†’The color palette is intentionally minimal, favoring a neutral foundation with a single vibrant accent. This approach ensures the design feels clean and professional while allowing content to remain the primary focus.
    92â†’
    93â†’#### Design Rationale
    94â†’
    95â†’The palette is built around **three core color families**:
    96â†’1. **Foundation Colors** (Black & White) - Maximum contrast and clarity
    97â†’2. **Neutral Grays** - An 8-step scale for subtle variations and hierarchy
    98â†’3. **Accent Colors** - Teal for warmth, Blue for external platforms
    99â†’
   100â†’The teal accent (#36BCAB) was chosen to add personality and warmth to an otherwise neutral palette. It evokes approachability and energy without being overwhelming.
   101â†’
   102â†’---
   103â†’
   104â†’#### Foundation Colors
   105â†’
   106â†’These provide the base contrast for the entire design system.
   107â†’
   108â†’| Variable | Hex Code | Visual | Usage | Notes |
   109â†’|----------|----------|--------|-------|-------|
   110â†’| `--color-black` | `#000000` | â¬› | Primary headings (h1, h2.section-title, h3), high-emphasis text | Highest contrast, used sparingly for maximum impact |
   111â†’| `--color-white` | `#FFFFFF` | â¬œ | Page backgrounds, input fields, button text on colored backgrounds | Pure white for clean, modern aesthetic |
   112â†’
   113â†’**Accessibility:**
   114â†’- Black on white: **21:1** contrast ratio (WCAG AAA for all text sizes)
   115â†’- White on black: **21:1** contrast ratio (WCAG AAA for all text sizes)
   116â†’
   117â†’---
   118â†’
   119â†’#### Neutral Grays
   120â†’
   121â†’An 8-step gray scale provides nuanced hierarchy for text, borders, and backgrounds. The scale uses a non-linear progression optimized for readability and visual distinction.
   122â†’
   123â†’| Variable | Hex Code | Visual | Usage | Status | Notes |
   124â†’|----------|----------|--------|-------|--------|-------|
   125â†’| `--color-gray-50` | `#F3F3F3` | â—»ï¸ | *Reserved* | Unused | Lightest gray - available for subtle backgrounds |
   126â†’| `--color-gray-100` | `#F1F1F1` | â—»ï¸ | *Reserved* | Unused | Very light gray - available for hover states |
   127â†’| `--color-gray-200` | `#DDDDDD` | â—»ï¸ | Borders, dividers, widget outlines | **Active** | Subtle separation without harsh lines |
   128â†’| `--color-gray-300` | `#AAAAAA` | â—»ï¸ | *Reserved* | Unused | Mid-light gray - available for disabled states |
   129â†’| `--color-gray-500` | `#767676` | â—¼ï¸ | Input borders, form element outlines | **Active** | Medium gray for interactive boundaries |
   130â†’| `--color-gray-600` | `#666666` | â—¼ï¸ | Secondary text (taglines, footer, small text) | **Active** | Lower-emphasis text content |
   131â†’| `--color-gray-700` | `#555555` | â—¼ï¸ | Body text, standard content | **Active** | Primary text color across the site |
   132â†’| `--color-gray-800` | `#32373C` | â—¼ï¸ | *Reserved* | Unused | Dark gray - available for future use |
   133â†’| `--color-gray-900` | `#222222` | â—¼ï¸ | *Reserved* | Unused | Near-black - available for future use |
   134â†’
   135â†’**Accessibility (on white background):**
   136â†’- gray-200: **1.7:1** - Decorative only, not for text
   137â†’- gray-500: **4.6:1** - WCAG AA for large text (18px+)
   138â†’- gray-600: **5.7:1** - WCAG AA for all text sizes

   142â†’- The active grays (200, 500, 600, 700) form a well-balanced hierarchy
   143â†’- Reserved grays (50, 100, 300, 800, 900) are defined for future expansion
   144â†’- All grays use pure neutral values (no color temperature bias)
   145â†’

   147â†’
   148â†’#### Accent Colors
   149â†’
   150â†’Accent colors provide visual interest and semantic meaning. The teal is the primary brand color, while blue is reserved for specific external platform integrations.
   151â†’
   152â†’**Teal (Primary Accent)**
   153â†’
   154â†’| Variable | Hex Code | Visual | Usage | Notes |
   155â†’|----------|----------|--------|-------|-------|
   156â†’| `--color-teal-500` | `#36BCAB` | ğŸŸ¦ | Links, hover states, focus indicators, accent underlines | Primary interactive color throughout the site |
   157â†’
   158â†’**Accessibility:**
   159â†’- Teal on white: **3.3:1** - WCAG AA for large text only (18px+)
   160â†’- **Important:** Teal should only be used for interactive elements (links, buttons) or large text (18px+)
   161â†’- Never use teal for small body text - use gray-700 instead
   162â†’
   163â†’**Design Notes:**
   164â†’- The teal balances warmth and professionalism
   165â†’- Creates clear affordance for interactive elements
   166â†’- Adds personality without overwhelming the content
   167â†’
   168â†’**Blue (Platform Integration)**
   169â†’
   170â†’| Variable | Hex Code | Visual | Usage | Status | Notes |
   171â†’|----------|----------|--------|-------|--------|-------|
   172â†’| `--color-blue-500` | `#0073B1` | ğŸ”µ | LinkedIn button background | **Active** | Matches LinkedIn brand color |
   173â†’| `--color-blue-700` | `#2E4453` | ğŸ”µ | *Reserved* | Unused | Darker blue - available for future platform integrations |
   174â†’
   175â†’**Accessibility:**
   176â†’- Blue-500 with white text: **4.6:1** - WCAG AA for large text (18px+)
   177â†’- Blue-700 with white text: **9.3:1** - WCAG AAA for all text sizes

   182â†’- Blue-700 is available for darker platform color needs

   188â†’**When to use each color:**
   189â†’
   190â†’1. **Black (`--color-black`)**
   191â†’   - Main page headings (h1)

   193â†’   - Subsection headings (h3)

   697â†’### Spacing & Layout
   698â†’
   699â†’The spacing and layout system establishes consistent rhythm and structure throughout the design. Built on a **4px base unit**, the system ensures mathematical harmony and visual alignment across all components.
   700â†’
   701â†’#### Design Rationale
   702â†’
   703â†’The spacing system is designed around these core principles:
   704â†’
   705â†’1. **4px Base Unit** - All spacing is divisible by 4, creating a mathematical foundation for visual consistency
   706â†’2. **Predictable Scale** - Incremental steps (4px, 8px, 12px, 16px...) make spacing decisions intuitive
   707â†’3. **Limited Choices** - A focused set of spacing values prevents inconsistency and decision fatigue
   708â†’4. **Layout Flexibility** - Separate layout dimensions (content width, sidebar width) enable complex layouts
   709â†’5. **Subtle Borders** - Minimal border radii (2-3px) maintain clean, crisp edges
   710â†’6. **Smooth Transitions** - Two timing values cover all interaction needs
   711â†’
   712â†’**Philosophy:**
   713â†’
   714â†’The 4px grid system creates an invisible framework that aligns elements harmoniously. Rather than arbitrary pixel values, every spacing decision follows the scale. This mathematical consistency creates visual rhythm even when users aren't consciously aware of it.
   715â†’
   716â†’The layout dimensions (content-width, sidebar-width, gap) are derived from optimal reading line length (~580px content) and classic sidebar proportions. The system prioritizes readability over maximizing screen real estate.
   717â†’
   718â†’---
   719â†’
   720â†’#### Spacing Scale
   721â†’
   722â†’A 4px-based spacing scale provides 9 distinct spacing values for vertical rhythm, horizontal gaps, padding, and margins.
   723â†’
   724â†’| Variable | Value | Multiplier | Usage | Common Use Cases |
   725â†’|----------|-------|------------|-------|------------------|
   726â†’| `--space-1` | 4px | 1Ã— | Micro spacing, tight gaps | Tag padding, small UI element gaps, subtle separation |
   727â†’| `--space-2` | 8px | 2Ã— | Extra small spacing | Button padding (vertical), list item gaps, tight content spacing |
   728â†’| `--space-3` | 12px | 3Ã— | Small spacing | Button padding (horizontal), paragraph margins, section spacing |
   729â†’| `--space-4` | 16px | 4Ã— | Base spacing unit | Standard gaps, padding between related elements, card spacing |
   730â†’| `--space-5` | 20px | 5Ã— | Medium spacing | Section margins, widget spacing, comfortable padding |
   731â†’| `--space-6` | 24px | 6Ã— | Large spacing | Major section separation, content block margins, generous padding |
   732â†’| `--space-8` | 32px | 8Ã— | Extra large spacing | Major layout gaps, significant visual breaks, footer padding |
   733â†’| `--space-10` | 40px | 10Ã— | 2xl spacing | Major section dividers, primary content area spacing, large gaps |
   734â†’| `--space-header` | 70px | Special | Header top spacing only | Dedicated spacing for site header from top edge |
   735â†’
   736â†’**Responsive Behavior:**
   737â†’
   738â†’The `--space-header` value adapts to conserve vertical space on smaller screens:
   739â†’
   740â†’| Breakpoint | --space-header | Notes |
   741â†’|------------|----------------|-------|
   742â†’| Desktop (>768px) | **70px** | Default - generous top spacing |
   743â†’| Tablet (â‰¤768px) | **50px** | Reduced to conserve space |
   744â†’| Mobile (â‰¤480px) | **32px** | Minimal spacing for small screens |
   745â†’
   746â†’All other spacing values remain static across breakpoints to maintain consistent rhythm.
   747â†’
   748â†’**Scale Rationale:**
   749â†’
   750â†’- **space-1 through space-6**: Linear progression (4px increments) for intuitive selection
   751â†’- **space-8**: Jump to 32px provides a significant visual break
   752â†’- **space-10**: 40px for major layout divisions
   753â†’- **No space-7 or space-9**: Intentional gaps in the scale prevent over-specification
   754â†’- **space-header**: Special-purpose value for header positioning
   755â†’
   756â†’**Spacing Selection Guidelines:**
   757â†’
   758â†’- **space-1 (4px)**: Elements that are tightly related (tag groups, inline lists)
   759â†’- **space-2 (8px)**: Compact components (button padding, tight sections)
   760â†’- **space-3 (12px)**: Related content (paragraph margins, list spacing)
   761â†’- **space-4 (16px)**: Default gap - use when unsure
   762â†’- **space-5 (20px)**: Standard section margins (widget spacing, content blocks)
   763â†’- **space-6 (24px)**: Major content separation (between components)
   764â†’- **space-8 (32px)**: Significant visual breaks (footer padding, major sections)
   765â†’- **space-10 (40px)**: Primary layout gaps (sidebar gap, major dividers)
   766â†’- **space-header (70px)**: Header positioning only
   767â†’

   769â†’
   770â†’#### Layout Dimensions
   771â†’
   772â†’Four layout dimensions define the structural foundation of the site's two-column layout (content + sidebar).
   773â†’
   774â†’| Variable | Value | Usage | Rationale |
   775â†’|----------|-------|-------|-----------|
   776â†’| `--content-width` | 580px | Main content area width | Optimal line length for readability (50-75 characters per line at 13px) |

   778â†’| `--container-max` | 860px | Maximum container width | Total width: content (580px) + gap (40px) + sidebar (240px) = 860px |
   779â†’| `--gap` | 40px | Space between content and sidebar | Comfortable visual separation without excessive whitespace |

    39â†’### Design Philosophy
    40â†’
    41â†’The Abe Diaz design system is built on principles of **clarity**, **simplicity**, and **intentional constraint**. Rather than offering unlimited flexibility, the system provides a curated set of design tokens and components that work harmoniously together.
    42â†’
    43â†’**Core Principles:**
    44â†’
    45â†’- **Minimalism First**: Every element serves a purpose. The design prioritizes content over decoration.
    46â†’- **Systematic Consistency**: A 4px spacing scale and carefully chosen color palette ensure visual harmony across the entire site.
    47â†’- **Performance-Conscious**: CSS-first approach with minimal JavaScript dependency for faster load times and better accessibility.
    48â†’- **Responsive by Default**: Mobile-first thinking with thoughtful breakpoints that adapt to different screen sizes without compromising the design intent.
    49â†’- **Accessibility Matters**: Color contrast ratios, semantic HTML, and keyboard navigation are first-class considerations.
    50â†’
    51â†’**Design Ethos:**
    52â†’
    53â†’This is a personal site for a technologist and evangelist. The design reflects the subject's personality: direct, authentic, and human. The teal accent color (#36BCAB) adds a touch of warmth to an otherwise neutral palette, while the Oswald typeface for headings provides strong visual hierarchy without being overly formal.
    54â†’
    55â†’The design system embraces constraints as a feature, not a limitation. By providing exactly what's neededâ€”no more, no lessâ€”it enables rapid development while maintaining consistency.

    77â†’  - Tablet (â‰¤768px)

    79â†’  - Small Mobile (â‰¤360px)
    80â†’
    81â†’The system is currently implemented as inline CSS in `index.html` and is designed to scale to a multi-page site with modular CSS architecture.
    82â†’
    83â†’---
    84â†’
    85â†’## Design Tokens
    86â†’
    87â†’Design tokens are the fundamental building blocks of the design systemâ€”the named values that define colors, typography, spacing, and other visual properties.
    88â†’
    89â†’### Color Palette
    90â†’
    91â†’The color palette is intentionally minimal, favoring a neutral foundation with a single vibrant accent. This approach ensures the design feels clean and professional while allowing content to remain the primary focus.
    92â†’
    93â†’#### Design Rationale
    94â†’
    95â†’The palette is built around **three core color families**:
    96â†’1. **Foundation Colors** (Black & White) - Maximum contrast and clarity
    97â†’2. **Neutral Grays** - An 8-step scale for subtle variations and hierarchy
    98â†’3. **Accent Colors** - Teal for warmth, Blue for external platforms
    99â†’
   100â†’The teal accent (#36BCAB) was chosen to add personality and warmth to an otherwise neutral palette. It evokes approachability and energy without being overwhelming.

   402â†’
   403â†’#### Font Weights
   404â†’
   405â†’Three font weights provide emphasis and hierarchy without overwhelming the design.
   406â†’
   407â†’| Variable | Value | CSS Name | Usage | Availability |
   408â†’|----------|-------|----------|-------|--------------|
   409â†’| `--font-light` | 300 | Light | Taglines (h2.tagline), subtle de-emphasis | Helvetica Neue only |
   410â†’| `--font-normal` | 400 | Regular | Body text, standard content, default weight | All font families |
   411â†’| `--font-bold` | 700 | Bold | Headings (h1, h2.section-title, h3), buttons, strong emphasis, labels | Oswald & system fonts |
   412â†’
   413â†’**Weight Usage Guidelines:**
   414â†’
   415â†’1. **Light (300)**
   416â†’   - Only used for h2.tagline
   417â†’   - Creates subtle, secondary text appearance
   418â†’   - Do NOT use for body text (reduces readability)
   419â†’   - Only available reliably in Helvetica Neue
   420â†’
   421â†’2. **Normal (400)**
   422â†’   - Default weight for all body text
   423â†’   - Paragraphs, links, standard UI elements
   424â†’   - Universally available across all fonts
   425â†’
   426â†’3. **Bold (700)**
   427â†’   - All headings use bold weight
   428â†’   - Buttons and prominent call-to-action elements
   429â†’   - Labels and emphasized UI text
   430â†’   - Oswald is designed to be used at bold weight
   431â†’
   432â†’**Typography Weights in Practice:**
   433â†’
   434â†’```css
   435â†’/* Headings - Always bold */
   436â†’h1, h2.section-title, h3 { font-weight: var(--font-bold); }
   437â†’
   438â†’/* Body text - Always normal */
   439â†’body, p, a { font-weight: var(--font-normal); }
   440â†’
   441â†’/* Tagline - Light for subtle de-emphasis */
   442â†’h2.tagline { font-weight: var(--font-light); }
   443â†’
   444â†’/* Buttons and labels - Bold for emphasis */
   445â†’.btn, label { font-weight: var(--font-bold); }
   446â†’```
   447â†’
   448â†’---
   449â†’
   450â†’#### Typography Pairing & Hierarchy
   451â†’
   452â†’The system establishes clear hierarchy through intentional font pairing and size relationships.
   453â†’
   454â†’**Primary Typography Patterns:**
   455â†’
   456â†’| Element | Font Family | Size | Weight | Transform | Color | Line Height |
   457â†’|---------|-------------|------|--------|-----------|-------|-------------|
   458â†’| **h1** | Oswald | 80px (4xl) | Bold (700) | UPPERCASE | Black | 1 |
   459â†’| **h2.tagline** | Helvetica Neue | 14px (md) | Light (300) | none | Gray-600 | Default |
   460â†’| **h2.section-title** | Oswald | 14px (md) | Bold (700) | UPPERCASE | Black | 1.2 |
   461â†’| **h3** | Oswald | 16px (lg) | Bold (700) | UPPERCASE | Black | 1 |
   462â†’| **Body (p)** | Helvetica Neue | 13px (base) | Normal (400) | none | Gray-700 | 1.75 |
   463â†’| **Navigation** | Oswald | 12px (sm) | Bold (700) | UPPERCASE | Gray-700 | Default |
   464â†’| **Buttons** | Oswald | 12px (sm) | Bold (700) | UPPERCASE | Varies | Default |
   465â†’| **Form Inputs** | System | 11px (xs) | Normal (400) | none | Gray-700 | Default |
   466â†’
   467â†’**Hierarchy Principles:**
   468â†’
   469â†’1. **Size Contrast**: h1 (80px) vs body (13px) = 6:1 ratio creates dramatic hierarchy
   470â†’2. **Weight Contrast**: Bold headings vs normal body creates clear distinction
   471â†’3. **Case Contrast**: UPPERCASE headings vs sentence case body reinforces hierarchy
   472â†’4. **Color Contrast**: Black headings vs gray-700 body provides subtle hierarchy
   473â†’5. **Line Height Contrast**: Tight headings (1.0) vs comfortable body (1.75)
   474â†’
   475â†’**Pairing Guidelines:**
   476â†’
   477â†’- âœ… **Do:** Pair Oswald headings with Helvetica Neue body text
   478â†’- âœ… **Do:** Use UPPERCASE for Oswald headings to maximize impact
   479â†’- âœ… **Do:** Maintain tight line-height (1.0-1.2) for headings
   480â†’- âœ… **Do:** Use generous line-height (1.75) for body text
   481â†’- âŒ **Don't:** Mix Oswald and Helvetica within the same heading level
   482â†’- âŒ **Don't:** Use Oswald for body text (not designed for reading)
   483â†’- âŒ **Don't:** Use sentence case for Oswald headings (reduces impact)
   484â†’- âŒ **Don't:** Use font-light (300) for anything other than taglines
   485â†’
   486â†’---
   487â†’
   488â†’#### Line Height & Letter Spacing
   489â†’
   490â†’Vertical rhythm and spacing are critical for readability.
   491â†’
   492â†’**Line Height Values:**
   493â†’
   494â†’| Element | Line Height | Rationale |
   495â†’|---------|-------------|-----------|
   496â†’| Headings (h1-h6) | 1.0 | Tight spacing for visual impact and compactness |
   497â†’| h2.section-title | 1.2 | Slightly more breathing room than h1 |
   498â†’| Body text | 1.75 | Generous spacing for comfortable reading |
   499â†’| Mobile body | 1.6 | Slightly tighter on mobile to conserve space |
   500â†’
   501â†’**Letter Spacing:**
   502â†’
   503â†’- **Default**: 0 (normal) for all elements
   504â†’- **h1 on mobile**: -1px to compensate for dramatically reduced size
   505â†’- **Uppercase text**: Inherits default (0) - Oswald is designed for tight uppercase tracking
   506â†’
   507â†’**Best Practices:**
   508â†’
   509â†’- Body text line-height (1.75) is optimized for 13px font size
   510â†’- Heading line-height (1.0) creates visual density and impact
   511â†’- Do NOT adjust letter-spacing unless on mobile h1
   512â†’- Trust the typeface design - Oswald is optimized for uppercase use
   513â†’
   514â†’---
   515â†’
   516â†’#### Responsive Typography
   517â†’
   518â†’Typography adapts thoughtfully across three breakpoints to maintain readability and hierarchy.
   519â†’
   520â†’**Desktop (Default, >768px):**
   521â†’- h1: 80px, letter-spacing: 0
   522â†’- Body: 13px, line-height: 1.75
   523â†’- All other sizes: Standard scale
   524â†’
   525â†’**Tablet/Mobile (â‰¤480px):**
   526â†’```css
   527â†’:root {
   528â†’  --text-4xl: 32px;  /* h1 dramatically reduced */
   529â†’  --text-base: 14px; /* body slightly increased for mobile readability */
   530â†’}
   531â†’
   532â†’body {
   533â†’  line-height: 1.6;  /* slightly tighter to conserve vertical space */
   534â†’}
   535â†’
   536â†’h1 {
   537â†’  letter-spacing: -1px; /* tighten spacing to compensate for size reduction */
   538â†’}
   539â†’
   540â†’h2.tagline,
   541â†’h2.section-title,
   542â†’h3 {
   543â†’  /* Sizes adjust using updated CSS variables */
   544â†’}
   545â†’```
   546â†’
   547â†’**Small Mobile (â‰¤360px):**
   548â†’```css
   549â†’:root {
   550â†’  --text-4xl: 28px;  /* h1 further reduced for tiny screens */
   551â†’}
   552â†’```
   553â†’
   554â†’**Responsive Strategy:**
   555â†’
   556â†’1. **Dramatic h1 reduction** (80px â†’ 32px â†’ 28px) prevents overflow
   557â†’2. **Body size increase** on mobile (13px â†’ 14px) improves readability on small screens
   558â†’3. **Line-height reduction** on mobile (1.75 â†’ 1.6) conserves vertical space
   559â†’4. **Negative letter-spacing** on h1 compensates for size reduction
   560â†’
   561â†’---
   562â†’
   563â†’#### Usage Guidelines
   564â†’
   565â†’**When to use each font family:**
   566â†’
   567â†’1. **--font-heading (Oswald)**
   568â†’   - All heading elements (h1, h2.section-title, h3)
   569â†’   - Navigation links
   570â†’   - Button text
   571â†’   - Widget headings
   572â†’   - Labels that need emphasis
   573â†’   - ANY element that needs visual weight and hierarchy
   574â†’
   575â†’2. **--font-body (Helvetica Neue)**
   576â†’   - All body paragraphs
   577â†’   - Links within content
   578â†’   - Taglines (h2.tagline)
   579â†’   - Secondary descriptive text
   580â†’   - Footer text
   581â†’   - Most UI elements
   582â†’
   583â†’3. **--font-system (System fonts)**
   584â†’   - Form input fields
   585â†’   - Email signup inputs
   586â†’   - Platform-native UI elements
   587â†’   - Elements that should feel "native" to the OS
   588â†’
   589â†’**When to use each font size:**
   590â†’
   591â†’- **text-xs (11px)**: Form labels, input placeholders, very small UI text
   592â†’- **text-sm (12px)**: Navigation, buttons, footer, compact labels
   593â†’- **text-base (13px)**: Default for all body content
   594â†’- **text-md (14px)**: Taglines, secondary headings on mobile
   595â†’- **text-lg (16px)**: h3 headings, prominent UI elements
   596â†’- **text-4xl (80px)**: h1 ONLY - never use elsewhere
   597â†’
   598â†’**When to use each font weight:**

  4340â†’---
  4341â†’
  4342â†’## Responsive Design
  4343â†’
  4344â†’### Breakpoints
  4345â†’
  4346â†’The design system uses a **desktop-first responsive strategy** with three strategic breakpoints that adapt the design for progressively smaller screens. Each breakpoint introduces specific overrides to maintain readability, usability, and visual hierarchy.
  4347â†’
  4348â†’#### Design Rationale
  4349â†’
  4350â†’The breakpoint system is designed around **real-world device categories** rather than arbitrary pixel values:
  4351â†’
  4352â†’1. **768px (Tablet)** - iPads and tablet devices in portrait mode
  4353â†’2. **480px (Mobile)** - Standard smartphones in portrait orientation
  4354â†’3. **360px (Small Phones)** - Compact Android devices and older iPhones
  4355â†’
  4356â†’This **desktop-first approach** (`max-width` media queries) means:
  4357â†’- Base styles are optimized for desktop/larger screens
  4358â†’- Each breakpoint progressively simplifies and condenses the layout
  4359â†’- Override only what's necessaryâ€”most styles cascade from desktop defaults
  4360â†’
  4361â†’#### Breakpoint Overview
  4362â†’
  4363â†’| Breakpoint | Media Query | Target Devices | Strategy | Changes |
  4364â†’|------------|-------------|----------------|----------|---------|
  4365â†’| **Desktop** | Default (>768px) | Laptops, desktops, large tablets | Base styles | All default design tokens |
  4366â†’| **Tablet** | `@media (max-width: 768px)` | iPads, medium tablets | Moderate scaling | Reduced h1 size, header padding, full-width content |
  4367â†’| **Mobile** | `@media (max-width: 480px)` | Smartphones | Aggressive adaptation | Smaller typography, flexible navigation, compact spacing |
  4368â†’| **Small Mobile** | `@media (max-width: 360px)` | Compact phones | Minimal refinement | Further h1 reduction, tighter padding |
  4369â†’
  4370â†’---
  4371â†’
  4372â†’#### Desktop (Default, >768px)
  4373â†’
  4374â†’The desktop layout represents the **canonical design** with full spacing, large typography, and two-column layout.
  4375â†’
  4376â†’**No media queries required** - these are the default CSS variable values:
  4377â†’
  4378â†’```css
  4379â†’:root {
  4380â†’  --text-4xl: 80px;
  4381â†’  --text-base: 13px;
  4382â†’  --space-header: 70px;
  4383â†’}
  4384â†’
  4385â†’body {
  4386â†’  line-height: 1.75;
  4387â†’}
  4388â†’
  4389â†’.site-container {
  4390â†’  max-width: var(--container-max); /* 860px */
  4391â†’  padding: 0 var(--space-6); /* 24px */
  4392â†’}
  4393â†’
  4394â†’.content {
  4395â†’  max-width: var(--content-width); /* 580px */
  4396â†’}
  4397â†’```
  4398â†’
  4399â†’**Characteristics:**
  4400â†’- Two-column layout (content + sidebar)
  4401â†’- Large h1 (80px) with dramatic visual impact
  4402â†’- Generous spacing throughout (24px container padding, 70px header padding)
  4403â†’- Optimal line-height (1.75) for comfortable reading
  4404â†’
  4405â†’---
  4406â†’
  4407â†’#### Tablet (â‰¤768px)
  4408â†’
  4409â†’The first breakpoint begins adapting the design for **medium-sized screens** like iPads and tablets.
  4410â†’
  4411â†’```css
  4412â†’@media (max-width: 768px) {
  4413â†’  :root {
  4414â†’    --text-4xl: 48px;       /* h1 reduced from 80px â†’ 48px */
  4415â†’    --space-header: 50px;   /* header padding reduced from 70px â†’ 50px */
  4416â†’  }
  4417â†’
  4418â†’  .site-container {
  4419â†’    padding: 0 var(--space-4); /* 16px horizontal padding */
  4420â†’  }
  4421â†’
  4422â†’  .content {
  4423â†’    max-width: 100%;        /* content area takes full width */
  4424â†’  }
  4425â†’}
  4426â†’```
  4427â†’
  4428â†’**Key Changes:**
  4429â†’
  4430â†’| Element | Desktop Value | Tablet Value | Change | Rationale |
  4431â†’|---------|---------------|--------------|--------|-----------|
  4432â†’| h1 size (`--text-4xl`) | 80px | 48px | -40% | Prevents overflow, maintains hierarchy |
  4433â†’| Header padding (`--space-header`) | 70px | 50px | -29% | Conserves vertical space |
  4434â†’| Container padding | 24px | 16px | -33% | More content width on narrower screens |
  4435â†’| Content max-width | 580px | 100% | Full width | Eliminates sidebar, uses all available space |
  4436â†’
  4437â†’**Visual Impact:**
  4438â†’- h1 is still large (48px) but won't overwhelm tablet screens
  4439â†’- Content area expands to full width (sidebar may collapse or stack below)
  4440â†’- Slightly tighter padding creates more breathing room for content
  4441â†’- Header reduces vertical space consumption
  4442â†’
  4443â†’---
  4444â†’
  4445â†’#### Mobile (â‰¤480px)
  4446â†’
  4447â†’The mobile breakpoint introduces **significant adaptations** for smartphone screens, prioritizing readability and touch-friendly interactions.
  4448â†’
  4449â†’```css
  4450â†’@media (max-width: 480px) {
  4451â†’  /* CSS Variable Overrides */
  4452â†’  :root {
  4453â†’    --text-4xl: 32px;       /* h1 dramatically reduced: 48px â†’ 32px */
  4454â†’    --text-base: 14px;      /* body text increased: 13px â†’ 14px */
  4455â†’    --space-header: 32px;   /* header padding further reduced: 50px â†’ 32px */
  4456â†’  }
  4457â†’
  4458â†’  /* Base Element Adjustments */
  4459â†’  body {
  4460â†’    line-height: 1.6;       /* tighter line-height: 1.75 â†’ 1.6 */
  4461â†’  }
  4462â†’
  4463â†’  .site-container {
  4464â†’    padding: 0 var(--space-4); /* maintains 16px padding */
  4465â†’  }
  4466â†’
  4467â†’  /* Typography Refinements */
  4468â†’  h1 {
  4469â†’    letter-spacing: -1px;   /* tighten spacing to compensate for size reduction */
  4470â†’  }
  4471â†’
  4472â†’  h2.tagline {
  4473â†’    font-size: var(--text-base); /* 14px (uses updated --text-base) */
  4474â†’  }
  4475â†’
  4476â†’  h2.section-title {
  4477â†’    font-size: var(--text-base);      /* 14px */
  4478â†’    margin-bottom: var(--space-4);    /* 16px */
  4479â†’  }
  4480â†’
  4481â†’  h3 {
  4482â†’    font-size: var(--text-md); /* 14px */
  4483â†’  }
  4484â†’
  4485â†’  /* Navigation Adaptations */
  4486â†’  .site-nav {
  4487â†’    margin-top: var(--space-4); /* 16px */
  4488â†’  }
  4489â†’
  4490â†’  .site-nav ul {
  4491â†’    flex-wrap: wrap;            /* navigation items wrap on small screens */
  4492â†’    gap: var(--space-4);        /* 16px gap between nav items */
  4493â†’  }
  4494â†’
  4495â†’  /* Content Components */
  4496â†’  .profile-image,
  4497â†’  .flight-stats {
  4498â†’    margin: var(--space-4) 0;   /* 16px vertical margin (reduced from 20px) */
  4499â†’  }
  4500â†’
  4501â†’  p {
  4502â†’    margin-bottom: var(--space-4); /* 16px paragraph spacing */
  4503â†’  }
  4504â†’
  4505â†’  /* Footer Section */
  4506â†’  .contact-section {
  4507â†’    margin-top: var(--space-6);     /* 24px */
  4508â†’    padding-top: var(--space-5);    /* 20px */
  4509â†’    padding-bottom: var(--space-8); /* 32px */
  4510â†’  }
  4511â†’
  4512â†’  /* Social Links */
  4513â†’  .social-links-inline {
  4514â†’    gap: var(--space-6); /* 24px gap between social links */
  4515â†’  }
  4516â†’
  4517â†’  .social-links-inline a {
  4518â†’    font-size: var(--text-md);      /* 14px */
  4519â†’    padding: var(--space-2) 0;      /* 8px vertical padding */
  4520â†’  }
  4521â†’}
  4522â†’```
  4523â†’
  4524â†’**Key Changes:**
  4525â†’
  4526â†’| Element/Property | Desktop | Mobile | Change | Rationale |
  4527â†’|------------------|---------|--------|--------|-----------|

This design system follows the **modern box-model reset** philosophy: 4753â†’ 4754â†’1. **Universal Box-Sizing** - Apply `border-box` to all elements for intuitive sizing 4755â†’2. **Zero Margins & Padding** - Remove browser defaults to prevent layout surprises 4756â†’3. **Preserve Semantic Defaults** - Let browsers handle accessibility features (focus outlines, form controls) 4757â†’ 4758â†’This approach provides: 4759â†’- âœ… **Predictability** - Elements behave consistently across browsers 4760â†’- âœ… **Control** - Explicit spacing decisions, no hidden browser defaults 4761â†’- âœ… **Simplicity** - Minimal reset code, easier to understand and maintain 4762â†’- âœ… **Accessibility** - Preserves important browser features like focus indicators 4763â†’ 4764â†’--- 4765â†’ 4766â†’#### Universal Reset 4767â†’ 4768â†’All elements, including pseudo-elements (`::before`, `::after`), receive the same baseline reset: 4769â†’ 4770â†’```css 4771â†’*, *::before, *::after { 4772â†’ box-sizing: border-box; 4773â†’ margin: 0; 4774â†’ padding: 0; 4775â†’} 4776â†’``` 4777â†’ 4778â†’**Property Breakdown:** 4779â†’ 4780â†’| Property | Value | Rationale | Impact | 4781â†’|----------|-------|-----------|--------| 4782â†’| `box-sizing` | `border-box` | Width/height includes padding and borders (not just content) | Makes sizing calculations intuitive and predictable | 4783â†’| `margin` | `0` | Removes all browser default margins | Prevents unexpected spacing between elements | 4784â†’| `padding` | `0` | Removes all browser default padding | Ensures consistent internal spacing | 4785â†’ 4786â†’**Why Border-Box?** 4787â†’ 4788â†’The default CSS box model (`content-box`) is counterintuitive: 4789â†’``` 4790â†’/* content-box (browser default) */ 4791â†’width: 300px + padding: 20px + border: 1px = 342px actual width 4792â†’ 4793â†’/* border-box (our approach) */ 4794â†’width: 300px (includes padding and border) = 300px actual width 4795â†’``` 4796â†’ 4797â†’With `border-box`, when you set `width: 300px`, the element is **exactly 300px wide** regardless of padding or borders. This makes responsive layouts and component sizing dramatically easier. 4798â†’ 4799â†’**Pseudo-Elements Included:** 4800â†’ 4801â†’Including `::before` and `::after` in the reset is crucial because: 4802â†’- These elements can add unexpected layout changes if they inherit different box models 4803â†’- Ensures decorative elements (icons, dividers) behave predictably 4804â†’- Prevents edge cases where pseudo-elements break layouts 4805â†’ 4806â†’--- 4807â†’ 4808â†’#### HTML Root Element 4809â†’ 4810â†’The `` element establishes the foundational typography and rendering settings for the entire document: 4811â†’ 4812â†’```css 4813â†’html { 4814â†’ font-size: 16px; 4815â†’ -webkit-font-smoothing: antialiased; 4816â†’ -moz-osx-font-smoothing: grayscale; 4817â†’} 4818â†’``` 4819â†’ 4820â†’**Property Breakdown:** 4821â†’ 4822â†’| Property | Value | Purpose | Notes | 4823â†’|----------|-------|---------|-------| 4824â†’| `font-size` | `16px` | Sets the root font size for rem calculations | Browser default is 16px, we make it explicit | 4825â†’| `-webkit-font-smoothing` | `antialiased` | Improves font rendering on WebKit browsers (Chrome, Safari, Edge) | Makes fonts appear lighter and smoother | 4826â†’| `-moz-osx-font-smoothing` | `grayscale` | Improves font rendering on Firefox/macOS | Prevents subpixel rendering artifacts | 4827â†’ 4828â†’**Root Font Size Strategy:** 4829â†’ 4830â†’While the design system uses `px` units for most typography (see [Typography System](#typography-system)), the `` font-size is set to `16px` to: 4831â†’- Maintain browser default for accessibility (users can still zoom) 4832â†’- Provide a stable base for any future `rem`-based spacing 4833â†’- Ensure consistent baseline across browsers 4834â†’ 4835â†’**Design Note:** The design system currently uses `px` units throughout (e.g., `var(--text-base): 13px`) rather than `rem` units. This is a deliberate choice for pixel-perfect control in a single-page design. If the site expands to multiple pages or requires more flexible scaling, consider migrating to `rem`-based typography. 4836â†’ 4837â†’--- 4838â†’ 4839â†’#### Body Element 4840â†’ 4841â†’The `` element establishes the default typography and color scheme for all content: 4842â†’ 4843â†’```css 4844â†’body { 4845â†’ font-family: var(--font-body); /* Helvetica Neue */ 4846â†’ font-size: var(--text-base); /* 13px */ 4847â†’ font-weight: var(--font-normal); /* 400 */ 4848â†’ line-height: 1.75; /* 22.75px for 13px text */ 4849â†’ color: var(--color-gray-700); /* #555555 */ 4850â†’ background-color: var(--color-white); /* #FFFFFF */ 4851â†’} 4852â†’``` 4853â†’ 4854â†’**Property Breakdown:** 4855â†’ 4856â†’| Property | Value | Token | Computed | Purpose | 4857â†’|----------|-------|-------|----------|---------| 4858â†’| `font-family` | `var(--font-body)` | Helvetica Neue, Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif | - | Clean, readable body text | 4859â†’| `font-size` | `var(--text-base)` | `13px` | 13px | Compact but readable base size | 4860â†’| `font-weight` | `var(--font-normal)` | `400` | 400 | Standard weight for body text | 4861â†’| `line-height` | `1.75` | - | 22.75px | Comfortable reading rhythm (1.5-1.8 is optimal) | 4862â†’| `color` | `var(--color-gray-700)` | `#555555` | Dark gray | Softer than pure black, easier on eyes | 4863â†’| `background-color` | `var(--color-white)` | `#FFFFFF` | Pure white | Clean, modern backdrop | 4864â†’ 4865â†’**Typography Rationale:** 4866â†’ 4867â†’- **13px base size:** Slightly smaller than the standard 16px, optimized for information density while maintaining readability. Matches Twitter's compact aesthetic. 4868â†’- **1.75 line-height:** Provides generous vertical rhythm. For 13px text, this creates ~22.75px line height (10px of breathing room between lines). 4869â†’- **Gray-700 color (#555555):** Softer than pure black (#000000), reducing eye strain during extended reading. Black is reserved for high-emphasis headings. 4870â†’ 4871â†’**Accessibility:** 4872â†’ 4873â†’- **Color contrast:** Gray-700 on white = **7.4:1** (WCAG AAA for normal text) 4874â†’- **Font size:** 13px is readable but approaches the minimum for comfortable reading. All interactive elements use larger sizes (14px+). 4875â†’- **Line height:** 1.75 exceeds WCAG recommendation of 1.5 for improved readability. 4876â†’ 4877â†’**Inheritance:** 4878â†’ 4879â†’All properties set on `` cascade to child elements unless explicitly overridden. This means: 4880â†’- All text inherits Helvetica Neue unless a component specifies a different font 4881â†’- All paragraphs inherit 13px/1.75 unless explicitly styled (e.g., headings use Oswald) 4882â†’- All content inherits gray-700 unless overridden (e.g., headings use black) 4883â†’ 4884â†’--- 4885â†’ 4886â†’#### Best Practices 4887â†’ 4888â†’**Do's:** 4889â†’ 4890â†’- âœ… **Do** rely on the universal reset for consistent spacingâ€”all margins/padding are intentional 4891â†’- âœ… **Do** use design tokens (`var(--color-gray-700)`) instead of hardcoded values 4892â†’- âœ… **Do** override body defaults for specific components (headings, widgets, forms) 4893â†’- âœ… **Do** maintain the 1.75 line-height for body text to ensure readability 4894â†’- âœ… **Do** preserve the border-box modelâ€”never override it with content-box 4895â†’ 4896â†’**Don'ts:** 4897â†’ 4898â†’- âŒ **Don't** set margins on elements expecting browser defaults (e.g., `

This section documents the browser-specific adjustments applied to ensure consistent visual presentation. 4909â†’ 4910â†’#### Font Smoothing 4911â†’ 4912â†’Font smoothing (also called anti-aliasing) affects how browsers render text, especially on non-retina displays. Different browsers use different default rendering methods, which can make the same font look dramatically different. 4913â†’ 4914â†’**WebKit Browsers (Chrome, Safari, Edge)** 4915â†’ 4916â†’```css 4917â†’-webkit-font-smoothing: antialiased; 4918â†’``` 4919â†’ 4920â†’| Value | Effect | Notes | 4921â†’|-------|--------|-------| 4922â†’| `antialiased` | Uses grayscale anti-aliasing instead of subpixel rendering | Makes fonts appear lighter and smoother | 4923â†’| `subpixel-antialiased` (default) | Uses RGB subpixel rendering | Can cause color fringing on non-retina displays | 4924â†’| `none` | No anti-aliasing | Produces jagged edges, not recommended | 4925â†’ 4926â†’**Why `antialiased`?** 4927â†’ 4928â†’- Creates consistent font weights across retina and non-retina displays 4929â†’- Prevents color fringing artifacts on LCD screens 4930â†’- Matches the design aesthetic (clean, modern, minimal) 4931â†’- **Trade-off:** Text appears slightly thinner than browser default 4932â†’ 4933â†’**Firefox on macOS** 4934â†’ 4935â†’```css 4936â†’-moz-osx-font-smoothing: grayscale; 4937â†’``` 4938â†’ 4939â†’| Value | Effect | Not ...     37â†’## Introduction
    38â†’
    39â†’### Design Philosophy
    40â†’
    41â†’The Abe Diaz design system is built on principles of **clarity**, **simplicity**, and **intentional constraint**. Rather than offering unlimited flexibility, the system provides a curated set of design tokens and components that work harmoniously together.
    42â†’
    43â†’**Core Principles:**
    44â†’
    45â†’- **Minimalism First**: Every element serves a purpose. The design prioritizes content over decoration.
    46â†’- **Systematic Consistency**: A 4px spacing scale and carefully chosen color palette ensure visual harmony across the entire site.
    47â†’- **Performance-Conscious**: CSS-first approach with minimal JavaScript dependency for faster load times and better accessibility.
    48â†’- **Responsive by Default**: Mobile-first thinking with thoughtful breakpoints that adapt to different screen sizes without compromising the design intent.
    49â†’- **Accessibility Matters**: Color contrast ratios, semantic HTML, and keyboard navigation are first-class considerations.
    50â†’
    51â†’**Design Ethos:**
    52â†’
    53â†’This is a personal site for a technologist and evangelist. The design reflects the subject's personality: direct, authentic, and human. The teal accent color (#36BCAB) adds a touch of warmth to an otherwise neutral palette, while the Oswald typeface for headings provides strong visual hierarchy without being overly formal.
    54â†’
    55â†’The design system embraces constraints as a feature, not a limitation. By providing exactly what's neededâ€”no more, no lessâ€”it enables rapid development while maintaining consistency.
    56â†’
    57â†’### Overview
    58â†’
    59â†’This documentation covers approximately 520 lines of CSS organized into:
    60â†’
    61â†’- **43 CSS Custom Properties** (Design Tokens)
    62â†’  - 14 color primitives
    63â†’  - 10 typography tokens (fonts, sizes, weights)
    64â†’  - 11 spacing values (4px-based scale)
    65â†’  - 4 layout dimensions
    66â†’  - 2 border radii
    67â†’  - 2 transition timings
    68â†’
    69â†’- **15+ UI Components**
    70â†’  - Layout structures (container, header, sidebar, footer)
    71â†’  - Typography variants (headings, links, paragraphs)
    72â†’  - Interactive elements (buttons, forms)
    73â†’  - Content modules (widgets, profile, contact sections)
    74â†’
    75â†’- **3 Responsive Breakpoints**
    76â†’  - Desktop (default)
    77â†’  - Tablet (â‰¤768px)
    78â†’  - Mobile (â‰¤480px)
    79â†’  - Small Mobile (â‰¤360px)
    80â†’
    81â†’The system is currently implemented as inline CSS in `index.html` and is designed to scale to a multi-page site with modular CSS architecture.
    82â†’
    83â†’---
    84â†’
    85â†’## Design Tokens
    86â†’
    87â†’Design tokens are the fundamental building blocks of the design systemâ€”the named values that define colors, typography, spacing, and other visual properties.
    88â†’
    89â†’### Color Palette
    90â†’
    91â†’The color palette is intentionally minimal, favoring a neutral foundation with a single vibrant accent. This approach ensures the design feels clean and professional while allowing content to remain the primary focus.
    92â†’
    93â†’#### Design Rationale
    94â†’
    95â†’The palette is built around **three core color families**:
    96â†’1. **Foundation Colors** (Black & White) - Maximum contrast and clarity
    97â†’2. **Neutral Grays** - An 8-step scale for subtle variations and hierarchy
    98â†’3. **Accent Colors** - Teal for warmth, Blue for external platforms
    99â†’
   100â†’The teal accent (#36BCAB) was chosen to add personality and warmth to an otherwise neutral palette. It evokes approachability and energy without being overwhelming.

    37â†’## Introduction
    38â†’
    39â†’### Design Philosophy
    40â†’
    41â†’The Abe Diaz design system is built on principles of **clarity**, **simplicity**, and **intentional constraint**. Rather than offering unlimited flexibility, the system provides a curated set of design tokens and components that work harmoniously together.
    42â†’
    43â†’**Core Principles:**
    44â†’
    45â†’- **Minimalism First**: Every element serves a purpose. The design prioritizes content over decoration.
    46â†’- **Systematic Consistency**: A 4px spacing scale and carefully chosen color palette ensure visual harmony across the entire site.
    47â†’- **Performance-Conscious**: CSS-first approach with minimal JavaScript dependency for faster load times and better accessibility.
    48â†’- **Responsive by Default**: Mobile-first thinking with thoughtful breakpoints that adapt to different screen sizes without compromising the design intent.
    49â†’- **Accessibility Matters**: Color contrast ratios, semantic HTML, and keyboard navigation are first-class considerations.
    50â†’
    51â†’**Design Ethos:**
    52â†’
    53â†’This is a personal site for a technologist and evangelist. The design reflects the subject's personality: direct, authentic, and human. The teal accent color (#36BCAB) adds a touch of warmth to an otherwise neutral palette, while the Oswald typeface for headings provides strong visual hierarchy without being overly formal.
    54â†’
    55â†’The design system embraces constraints as a feature, not a limitation. By providing exactly what's neededâ€”no more, no lessâ€”it enables rapid development while maintaining consistency.
    56â†’
    57â†’### Overview
    58â†’
    59â†’This documentation covers approximately 520 lines of CSS organized into:
    60â†’
    61â†’- **43 CSS Custom Properties** (Design Tokens)
    62â†’  - 14 color primitives
    63â†’  - 10 typography tokens (fonts, sizes, weights)
    64â†’  - 11 spacing values (4px-based scale)
    65â†’  - 4 layout dimensions
    66â†’  - 2 border radii
    67â†’  - 2 transition timings
    68â†’
    69â†’- **15+ UI Components**
    70â†’  - Layout structures (container, header, sidebar, footer)
    71â†’  - Typography variants (headings, links, paragraphs)
    72â†’  - Interactive elements (buttons, forms)
    73â†’  - Content modules (widgets, profile, contact sections)
    74â†’
    75â†’- **3 Responsive Breakpoints**
    76â†’  - Desktop (default)
    77â†’  - Tablet (â‰¤768px)
    78â†’  - Mobile (â‰¤480px)
    79â†’  - Small Mobile (â‰¤360px)
    80â†’
    81â†’The system is currently implemented as inline CSS in `index.html` and is designed to scale to a multi-page site with modular CSS architecture.
    82â†’
    83â†’---
    84â†’
    85â†’## Design Tokens
    86â†’
    87â†’Design tokens are the fundamental building blocks of the design systemâ€”the named values that define colors, typography, spacing, and other visual properties.
    88â†’
    89â†’### Color Palette
    90â†’
    91â†’The color palette is intentionally minimal, favoring a neutral foundation with a single vibrant accent. This approach ensures the design feels clean and professional while allowing content to remain the primary focus.
    92â†’
    93â†’#### Design Rationale
    94â†’
    95â†’The palette is built around **three core color families**:
    96â†’1. **Foundation Colors** (Black & White) - Maximum contrast and clarity
    97â†’2. **Neutral Grays** - An 8-step scale for subtle variations and hierarchy
    98â†’3. **Accent Colors** - Teal for warmth, Blue for external platforms
    99â†’
   100â†’The teal accent (#36BCAB) was chosen to add personality and warmth to an otherwise neutral palette. It evokes approachability and energy without being overwhelming.

    37â†’## Introduction
    38â†’
    39â†’### Design Philosophy
    40â†’
    41â†’The Abe Diaz design system is built on principles of **clarity**, **simplicity**, and **intentional constraint**. Rather than offering unlimited flexibility, the system provides a curated set of design tokens and components that work harmoniously together.
    42â†’
    43â†’**Core Principles:**
    44â†’
    45â†’- **Minimalism First**: Every element serves a purpose. The design prioritizes content over decoration.
    46â†’- **Systematic Consistency**: A 4px spacing scale and carefully chosen color palette ensure visual harmony across the entire site.
    47â†’- **Performance-Conscious**: CSS-first approach with minimal JavaScript dependency for faster load times and better accessibility.
    48â†’- **Responsive by Default**: Mobile-first thinking with thoughtful breakpoints that adapt to different screen sizes without compromising the design intent.
    49â†’- **Accessibility Matters**: Color contrast ratios, semantic HTML, and keyboard navigation are first-class considerations.
    50â†’
    51â†’**Design Ethos:**
    52â†’
    53â†’This is a personal site for a technologist and evangelist. The design reflects the subject's personality: direct, authentic, and human. The teal accent color (#36BCAB) adds a touch of warmth to an otherwise neutral palette, while the Oswald typeface for headings provides strong visual hierarchy without being overly formal.
    54â†’
    55â†’The design system embraces constraints as a feature, not a limitation. By providing exactly what's neededâ€”no more, no lessâ€”it enables rapid development while maintaining consistency.
    56â†’
    57â†’### Overview
    58â†’
    59â†’This documentation covers approximately 520 lines of CSS organized into:
    60â†’
    61â†’- **43 CSS Custom Properties** (Design Tokens)
    62â†’  - 14 color primitives
    63â†’  - 10 typography tokens (fonts, sizes, weights)
    64â†’  - 11 spacing values (4px-based scale)
    65â†’  - 4 layout dimensions
    66â†’  - 2 border radii
    67â†’  - 2 transition timings
    68â†’
    69â†’- **15+ UI Components**
    70â†’  - Layout structures (container, header, sidebar, footer)
    71â†’  - Typography variants (headings, links, paragraphs)
    72â†’  - Interactive elements (buttons, forms)
    73â†’  - Content modules (widgets, profile, contact sections)
    74â†’
    75â†’- **3 Responsive Breakpoints**
    76â†’  - Desktop (default)
    77â†’  - Tablet (â‰¤768px)
    78â†’  - Mobile (â‰¤480px)
    79â†’  - Small Mobile (â‰¤360px)
    80â†’
    81â†’The system is currently implemented as inline CSS in `index.html` and is designed to scale to a multi-page site with modular CSS architecture.
    82â†’
    83â†’---
    84â†’
    85â†’## Design Tokens
    86â†’
    87â†’Design tokens are the fundamental building blocks of the design systemâ€”the named values that define colors, typography, spacing, and other visual properties.
    88â†’
    89â†’### Color Palette
    90â†’
    91â†’The color palette is intentionally minimal, favoring a neutral foundation with a single vibrant accent. This approach ensures the design feels clean and professional while allowing content to remain the primary focus.
    92â†’
    93â†’#### Design Rationale
    94â†’
    95â†’The palette is built around **three core color families**:
    96â†’1. **Foundation Colors** (Black & White) - Maximum contrast and clarity
    97â†’2. **Neutral Grays** - An 8-step scale for subtle variations and hierarchy
    98â†’3. **Accent Colors** - Teal for warmth, Blue for external platforms
    99â†’
   100â†’The teal accent (#36BCAB) was chosen to add personality and warmth to an otherwise neutral palette. It evokes approachability and energy without being overwhelming.
   101â†’
   102â†’---
   103â†’
   104â†’#### Foundation Colors
   105â†’
   106â†’These provide the base contrast for the entire design system.
   107â†’
   108â†’| Variable | Hex Code | Visual | Usage | Notes |
   109â†’|----------|----------|--------|-------|-------|
   110â†’| `--color-black` | `#000000` | â¬› | Primary headings (h1, h2.section-title, h3), high-emphasis text | Highest contrast, used sparingly for maximum impact |
   111â†’| `--color-white` | `#FFFFFF` | â¬œ | Page backgrounds, input fields, button text on colored backgrounds | Pure white for clean, modern aesthetic |
   112â†’
   113â†’**Accessibility:**
   114â†’- Black on white: **21:1** contrast ratio (WCAG AAA for all text sizes)
   115â†’- White on black: **21:1** contrast ratio (WCAG AAA for all text sizes)
   116â†’
   117â†’---
   118â†’
   119â†’#### Neutral Grays
   120â†’
   121â†’An 8-step gray scale provides nuanced hierarchy for text, borders, and backgrounds. The scale uses a non-linear progression optimized for readability and visual distinction.
   122â†’
   123â†’| Variable | Hex Code | Visual | Usage | Status | Notes |
   124â†’|----------|----------|--------|-------|--------|-------|
   125â†’| `--color-gray-50` | `#F3F3F3` | â—»ï¸ | *Reserved* | Unused | Lightest gray - available for subtle backgrounds |
   126â†’| `--color-gray-100` | `#F1F1F1` | â—»ï¸ | *Reserved* | Unused | Very light gray - available for hover states |
   127â†’| `--color-gray-200` | `#DDDDDD` | â—»ï¸ | Borders, dividers, widget outlines | **Active** | Subtle separation without harsh lines |
   128â†’| `--color-gray-300` | `#AAAAAA` | â—»ï¸ | *Reserved* | Unused | Mid-light gray - available for disabled states |
   129â†’| `--color-gray-500` | `#767676` | â—¼ï¸ | Input borders, form element outlines | **Active** | Medium gray for interactive boundaries |
   130â†’| `--color-gray-600` | `#666666` | â—¼ï¸ | Secondary text (taglines, footer, small text) | **Active** | Lower-emphasis text content |
   131â†’| `--color-gray-700` | `#555555` | â—¼ï¸ | Body text, standard content | **Active** | Primary text color across the site |
   132â†’| `--color-gray-800` | `#32373C` | â—¼ï¸ | *Reserved* | Unused | Dark gray - available for future use |

   134â†’

   136â†’- gray-200: **1.7:1** - Decorative only, not for text
   137â†’- gray-500: **4.6:1** - WCAG AA for large text (18px+)
   138â†’- gray-600: **5.7:1** - WCAG AA for all text sizes
   139â†’- gray-700: **7.4:1** - WCAG AAA for body text (13px+)
   140â†’
   141â†’**Design Notes:**
   142â†’- The active grays (200, 500, 600, 700) form a well-balanced hierarchy
   143â†’- Reserved grays (50, 100, 300, 800, 900) are defined for future expansion
   144â†’- All grays use pure neutral values (no color temperature bias)
   145â†’

   147â†’
   148â†’#### Accent Colors
   149â†’
   150â†’Accent colors provide visual interest and semantic meaning. The teal is the primary brand color, while blue is reserved for specific external platform integrations.

## Contributing

This design system evolves with the site. When extending or modifying:

1. **Use existing tokens first** - Before creating new values, check if existing design tokens can solve your need

    37â†’## Introduction
    38â†’
    39â†’### Design Philosophy
    40â†’
    41â†’The Abe Diaz design system is built on principles of **clarity**, **simplicity**, and **intentional constraint**. Rather than offering unlimited flexibility, the system provides a curated set of design tokens and components that work harmoniously together.
    42â†’
    43â†’**Core Principles:**
    44â†’
    45â†’- **Minimalism First**: Every element serves a purpose. The design prioritizes content over decoration.
    46â†’- **Systematic Consistency**: A 4px spacing scale and carefully chosen color palette ensure visual harmony across the entire site.
    47â†’- **Performance-Conscious**: CSS-first approach with minimal JavaScript dependency for faster load times and better accessibility.
    48â†’- **Responsive by Default**: Mobile-first thinking with thoughtful breakpoints that adapt to different screen sizes without compromising the design intent.
    49â†’- **Accessibility Matters**: Color contrast ratios, semantic HTML, and keyboard navigation are first-class considerations.
    50â†’
    51â†’**Design Ethos:**
    52â†’
    53â†’This is a personal site for a technologist and evangelist. The design reflects the subject's personality: direct, authentic, and human. The teal accent color (#36BCAB) adds a touch of warmth to an otherwise neutral palette, while the Oswald typeface for headings provides strong visual hierarchy without being overly formal.
    54â†’
    55â†’The design system embraces constraints as a feature, not a limitation. By providing exactly what's neededâ€”no more, no lessâ€”it enables rapid development while maintaining consistency.
    56â†’
    57â†’### Overview
    58â†’
    59â†’This documentation covers approximately 520 lines of CSS organized into:
    60â†’
    61â†’- **43 CSS Custom Properties** (Design Tokens)
    62â†’  - 14 color primitives
    63â†’  - 10 typography tokens (fonts, sizes, weights)
    64â†’  - 11 spacing values (4px-based scale)
    65â†’  - 4 layout dimensions
    66â†’  - 2 border radii
    67â†’  - 2 transition timings
    68â†’
    69â†’- **15+ UI Components**
    70â†’  - Layout structures (container, header, sidebar, footer)
    71â†’  - Typography variants (headings, links, paragraphs)
    72â†’  - Interactive elements (buttons, forms)
    73â†’  - Content modules (widgets, profile, contact sections)
    74â†’
    75â†’- **3 Responsive Breakpoints**
    76â†’  - Desktop (default)
    77â†’  - Tablet (â‰¤768px)
    78â†’  - Mobile (â‰¤480px)
    79â†’  - Small Mobile (â‰¤360px)
    80â†’
    81â†’The system is currently implemented as inline CSS in `index.html` and is designed to scale to a multi-page site with modular CSS architecture.
    82â†’
    83â†’---
    84â†’
    85â†’## Design Tokens
    86â†’
    87â†’Design tokens are the fundamental building blocks of the design systemâ€”the named values that define colors, typography, spacing, and other visual properties.
    88â†’
    89â†’### Color Palette
    90â†’
    91â†’The color palette is intentionally minimal, favoring a neutral foundation with a single vibrant accent. This approach ensures the design feels clean and professional while allowing content to remain the primary focus.
    92â†’
    93â†’#### Design Rationale
    94â†’
    95â†’The palette is built around **three core color families**:
    96â†’1. **Foundation Colors** (Black & White) - Maximum contrast and clarity
    97â†’2. **Neutral Grays** - An 8-step scale for subtle variations and hierarchy
    98â†’3. **Accent Colors** - Teal for warmth, Blue for external platforms
    99â†’
   100â†’The teal accent (#36BCAB) was chosen to add personality and warmth to an otherwise neutral palette. It evokes approachability and energy without being overwhelming.
   101â†’
   102â†’---
   103â†’
   104â†’#### Foundation Colors
   105â†’
   106â†’These provide the base contrast for the entire design system.
   107â†’
   108â†’| Variable | Hex Code | Visual | Usage | Notes |
   109â†’|----------|----------|--------|-------|-------|
   110â†’| `--color-black` | `#000000` | â¬› | Primary headings (h1, h2.section-title, h3), high-emphasis text | Highest contrast, used sparingly for maximum impact |
   111â†’| `--color-white` | `#FFFFFF` | â¬œ | Page backgrounds, input fields, button text on colored backgrounds | Pure white for clean, modern aesthetic |
   112â†’
   113â†’**Accessibility:**
   114â†’- Black on white: **21:1** contrast ratio (WCAG AAA for all text sizes)
   115â†’- White on black: **21:1** contrast ratio (WCAG AAA for all text sizes)
   116â†’
   117â†’---
   118â†’
   119â†’#### Neutral Grays
   120â†’
   121â†’An 8-step gray scale provides nuanced hierarchy for text, borders, and backgrounds. The scale uses a non-linear progression optimized for readability and visual distinction.
   122â†’
   123â†’| Variable | Hex Code | Visual | Usage | Status | Notes |
   124â†’|----------|----------|--------|-------|--------|-------|
   125â†’| `--color-gray-50` | `#F3F3F3` | â—»ï¸ | *Reserved* | Unused | Lightest gray - available for subtle backgrounds |
   126â†’| `--color-gray-100` | `#F1F1F1` | â—»ï¸ | *Reserved* | Unused | Very light gray - available for hover states |
   127â†’| `--color-gray-200` | `#DDDDDD` | â—»ï¸ | Borders, dividers, widget outlines | **Active** | Subtle separation without harsh lines |
   128â†’| `--color-gray-300` | `#AAAAAA` | â—»ï¸ | *Reserved* | Unused | Mid-light gray - available for disabled states |
   129â†’| `--color-gray-500` | `#767676` | â—¼ï¸ | Input borders, form element outlines | **Active** | Medium gray for interactive boundaries |
   130â†’| `--color-gray-600` | `#666666` | â—¼ï¸ | Secondary text (taglines, footer, small text) | **Active** | Lower-emphasis text content |
   131â†’| `--color-gray-700` | `#555555` | â—¼ï¸ | Body text, standard content | **Active** | Primary text color across the site |
   132â†’| `--color-gray-800` | `#32373C` | â—¼ï¸ | *Reserved* | Unused | Dark gray - available for future use |
   133â†’| `--color-gray-900` | `#222222` | â—¼ï¸ | *Reserved* | Unused | Near-black - available for future use |
   134â†’
   135â†’**Accessibility (on white background):**
   136â†’- gray-200: **1.7:1** - Decorative only, not for text
   137â†’- gray-500: **4.6:1** - WCAG AA for large text (18px+)
   138â†’- gray-600: **5.7:1** - WCAG AA for all text sizes
   139â†’- gray-700: **7.4:1** - WCAG AAA for body text (13px+)
   140â†’

   142â†’- The active grays (200, 500, 600, 700) form a well-balanced hierarchy
   143â†’- Reserved grays (50, 100, 300, 800, 900) are defined for future expansion
   144â†’- All grays use pure neutral values (no color temperature bias)
   145â†’
   146â†’---
   147â†’
   148â†’#### Accent Colors
   149â†’
   150â†’Accent colors provide visual interest and semantic meaning. The teal is the primary brand color, while blue is reserved for specific external platform integrations.
   151â†’
   152â†’**Teal (Primary Accent)**
   153â†’
   154â†’| Variable | Hex Code | Visual | Usage | Notes |
   155â†’|----------|----------|--------|-------|-------|
   156â†’| `--color-teal-500` | `#36BCAB` | ğŸŸ¦ | Links, hover states, focus indicators, accent underlines | Primary interactive color throughout the site |
   157â†’
   158â†’**Accessibility:**
   159â†’- Teal on white: **3.3:1** - WCAG AA for large text only (18px+)
   160â†’- **Important:** Teal should only be used for interactive elements (links, buttons) or large text (18px+)
   161â†’- Never use teal for small body text - use gray-700 instead
   162â†’
   163â†’**Design Notes:**
   164â†’- The teal balances warmth and professionalism
   165â†’- Creates clear affordance for interactive elements
   166â†’- Adds personality without overwhelming the content
   167â†’
   168â†’**Blue (Platform Integration)**
   169â†’
   170â†’| Variable | Hex Code | Visual | Usage | Status | Notes |

   172â†’| `--color-blue-500` | `#0073B1` | ğŸ”µ | LinkedIn button background | **Active** | Matches LinkedIn brand color |
   173â†’| `--color-blue-700` | `#2E4453` | ğŸ”µ | *Reserved* | Unused | Darker blue - available for future platform integrations |
   174â†’
   175â†’**Accessibility:**
   176â†’- Blue-500 with white text: **4.6:1** - WCAG AA for large text (18px+)
   177â†’- Blue-700 with white text: **9.3:1** - WCAG AAA for all text sizes

   181â†’- Helps users distinguish between site actions and external links
   182â†’- Blue-700 is available for darker platform color needs

37â†’## Introduction
    38â†’
    39â†’### Design Philosophy
    40â†’
    41â†’The Abe Diaz design system is built on principles of **clarity**, **simplicity**, and **intentional constraint**. Rather than offering unlimited flexibility, the system provides a curated set of design tokens and components that work harmoniously together.
    42â†’
    43â†’**Core Principles:**
    44â†’
    45â†’- **Minimalism First**: Every element serves a purpose. The design prioritizes content over decoration.
    46â†’- **Systematic Consistency**: A 4px spacing scale and carefully chosen color palette ensure visual harmony across the entire site.
    47â†’- **Performance-Conscious**: CSS-first approach with minimal JavaScript dependency for faster load times and better accessibility.
    48â†’- **Responsive by Default**: Mobile-first thinking with thoughtful breakpoints that adapt to different screen sizes without compromising the design intent.
    49â†’- **Accessibility Matters**: Color contrast ratios, semantic HTML, and keyboard navigation are first-class considerations.
    50â†’
    51â†’**Design Ethos:**
    52â†’
    53â†’This is a personal site for a technologist and evangelist. The design reflects the subject's personality: direct, authentic, and human. The teal accent color (#36BCAB) adds a touch of warmth to an otherwise neutral palette, while the Oswald typeface for headings provides strong visual hierarchy without being overly formal.
    54â†’
    55â†’The design system embraces constraints as a feature, not a limitation. By providing exactly what's neededâ€”no more, no lessâ€”it enables rapid development while maintaining consistency.
    56â†’
    57â†’### Overview
    58â†’
    59â†’This documentation covers approximately 520 lines of CSS organized into:
    60â†’
    61â†’- **43 CSS Custom Properties** (Design Tokens)
    62â†’  - 14 color primitives
    63â†’  - 12 typography tokens (3 fonts, 6 sizes, 3 weights)
    64â†’  - 9 spacing values (4px-based scale)
    65â†’  - 4 layout dimensions

    67â†’  - 2 transition timings
    68â†’

    70â†’  - Layout structures (container, header, sidebar, footer)
    71â†’  - Typography variants (headings, links, paragraphs)
    72â†’  - Interactive elements (buttons, forms)
    73â†’  - Content modules (widgets, profile, contact sections)

    76â†’  - Desktop (default)
    77â†’  - Tablet (â‰¤768px)
    78â†’  - Mobile (â‰¤480px)
    79â†’  - Small Mobile (â‰¤360px)
    80â†’
    81â†’The system is currently implemented as inline CSS in `index.html` and is designed to scale to a multi-page site with modular CSS architecture.

1099â†’## Components
  1100â†’
  1101â†’Components are reusable UI patterns built using the design tokens. Each component has a specific purpose and usage pattern.
  1102â†’
  1103â†’### Layout Components
  1104â†’
  1105â†’Layout components form the structural foundation of the site. These components establish the page architecture, content flow, and responsive behavior. Built using modern flexbox patterns, they provide a clean two-column layout on desktop that gracefully adapts to single-column on mobile.
  1106â†’
  1107â†’#### Design Rationale
  1108â†’
  1109â†’The layout system is designed around these principles:
  1110â†’
  1111â†’1. **Content-First Architecture** - The layout prioritizes readable content width (580px) over maximizing screen usage
  1112â†’2. **Flexible Two-Column Pattern** - Desktop layout supports content + sidebar; mobile stacks vertically
  1113â†’3. **Semantic HTML Structure** - Uses proper semantic elements (header, nav, main, article, footer)
  1114â†’4. **Flexbox-Based** - Modern flexbox provides reliable, predictable layout behavior
  1115â†’5. **Responsive by Default** - Layout adapts naturally at defined breakpoints without complex overrides
  1116â†’
  1117â†’**Philosophy:**
  1118â†’
  1119â†’The layout system uses a **container-constrained, content-focused** approach rather than full-width edge-to-edge design. This creates comfortable reading experiences and prevents content from becoming overwhelming on large screens. The two-column pattern (content + sidebar) follows classic blog/portfolio layouts where the primary content dominates (580px) and the sidebar provides supplementary information (240px).
  1120â†’
  1121â†’---
  1122â†’
  1123â†’#### Component Overview
  1124â†’
  1125â†’| Component | Purpose | Layout Method | Responsive Behavior |
  1126â†’|-----------|---------|---------------|---------------------|
  1127â†’| `.site-container` | Outer page container | Block with max-width centering | Max-width adapts, padding reduces on mobile |
  1128â†’| `.site-header` | Page header with branding and navigation | Block with vertical padding | Padding reduces on smaller screens |
  1129â†’| `.site-nav` | Navigation menu | Flexbox horizontal list | Wraps on mobile, gaps adjust |
  1130â†’| `.site-main` | Main content wrapper | Flexbox two-column | Becomes single-column on tablet (â‰¤768px) |
  1131â†’| `.content` | Primary content area | Flex item with fixed width | Becomes full-width on tablet (â‰¤768px) |
  1132â†’| `.sidebar` | Secondary content area (widgets) | Flex item with fixed width | Stacks below content on tablet (â‰¤768px) |
  1133â†’| `.site-footer` | Page footer | Block with border separator | Padding adjusts on mobile |
  1134â†’

4342â†’## Responsive Design
  4343â†’
  4344â†’### Breakpoints
  4345â†’
  4346â†’The design system uses a **desktop-first responsive strategy** with three strategic breakpoints that adapt the design for progressively smaller screens. Each breakpoint introduces specific overrides to maintain readability, usability, and visual hierarchy.
  4347â†’
  4348â†’#### Design Rationale
  4349â†’
  4350â†’The breakpoint system is designed around **real-world device categories** rather than arbitrary pixel values:
  4351â†’
  4352â†’1. **768px (Tablet)** - iPads and tablet devices in portrait mode
  4353â†’2. **480px (Mobile)** - Standard smartphones in portrait orientation
  4354â†’3. **360px (Small Phones)** - Compact Android devices and older iPhones
  4355â†’

    39â†’### Design Philosophy
    40â†’
    41â†’The Abe Diaz design system is built on principles of **clarity**, **simplicity**, and **intentional constraint**. Rather than offering unlimited flexibility, the system provides a curated set of design tokens and components that work harmoniously together.
    42â†’
    43â†’**Core Principles:**
    44â†’
    45â†’- **Minimalism First**: Every element serves a purpose. The design prioritizes content over decoration.
    46â†’- **Systematic Consistency**: A [4px spacing scale](#spacing--layout) and carefully chosen [color palette](#color-palette) ensure visual harmony across the entire site.
    47â†’- **Performance-Conscious**: CSS-first approach with minimal JavaScript dependency for faster load times and better accessibility.
    48â†’- **Responsive by Default**: Mobile-first thinking with thoughtful [breakpoints](#breakpoints) that adapt to different screen sizes without compromising the design intent.
    49â†’- **Accessibility Matters**: [Color contrast ratios](#accessibility-summary), semantic HTML, and keyboard navigation are first-class considerations.
    50â†’
    51â†’**Design Ethos:**
    52â†’
    53â†’This is a personal site for a technologist and evangelist. The design reflects the subject's personality: direct, authentic, and human. The [teal accent color](#accent-colors) (#36BCAB) adds a touch of warmth to an otherwise neutral palette, while the [Oswald typeface](#font-families) for headings provides strong visual hierarchy without being overly formal.
    54â†’
    55â†’The design system embraces constraints as a feature, not a limitation. By providing exactly what's neededâ€”no more, no lessâ€”it enables rapid development while maintaining consistency.
    56â†’
    57â†’### Overview
    58â†’

    61â†’- **43 CSS Custom Properties** ([Design Tokens](#design-tokens))
